title: 820-00875-01  damaged USB-C ports.
message:
I solder every day under a microscope and after looking at this I am totally intimidated.
I have successfully replaced the LVD display connector on this board but this is a whole new animal. 

Has anyone successfully replaced the USB-C port assembly?
I sure would appreciate some guidance. I have donor boards but don't really want to rape them as they are in my "to be fixed" pile. These boards so so so expensive.

title: 820-00875-01  damaged USB-C ports.
message: I just got off AliExpress and ordered 8 "pieces of a board" that had the port on it and USB chips.  We will just call it a "wing".    After looking at some of the pictures on AliExpress I think I understand how it goes together but am still intimidated. Looks like through hole.

title: 820-00875-01  damaged USB-C ports.
message:
Quik Chip alloy is the best option.
Choose 58 degrees version, but clean any remained solder, once port is removed.

title: 820-00875-01  damaged USB-C ports.
message: Yep lots of heat and low melt to remove, clean solder holes. Use leaded to install new port.
